text: Subscribe to the TMU newsletter for updates, events, news and more.

I am originally from the Dallas Texas area. Before moving to California, I lived in Paris, France for a year doing mission work. Now I am in California working on my online MBA through The Master’s University and working as an admissions counselor. This is an amazing place to work and study!

In my free time I like to paint watercolors, be outside, and visit fun places around Los Angeles. There is so much to do here in Santa Clarita: great little cafes, coffee shops, museums and the beach! One of my favorite coffee shops is a local place just down the street from TMU.

Transitioning from high school to University life is such an important and fun season. There is a great amount to learn and the University you choose will help shape who you become in the future. That is why I love being an admissions counselor and I am here to help you in the process.
“A man’s heart plans his way, But the LORD directs his steps.” Proverbs 16:9
My recommendation to prospective students is to start by reading the TMU
-  or even better, to do that in person at our

"Rooted in an unwavering devotion to Jesus Christ and the inerrant Word of God, our             world-class faculty and dedicated administration prepare each student's heart and mind for a life of eternal             influence."

Located only miles from beaches, mountains, the desert and Los Angeles, and ranked among one of California's safest cities, Santa Clarita may just be the perfect place to attend school. Nestled away in Placerita Canyon, The Master's University allows for endless opportunities for students, combining a small town feel with a big city experience.

The mission of The Master’s University is to empower students for a life of enduring commitment to Christ, biblical fidelity, moral integrity, intellectual growth and lasting contribution to the Kingdom of God worldwide.
We are now accepting undergraduate applications for Fall & Spring 2020. Prior to starting the application process, prospective students are encouraged to read the TMU

With you every step of the way: Meet your Admissions Counselor

Each admission counselor is an alum of Master's, and is knowledgeable in all areas of the university. Your counselor will provide you with fast, insightful, and practical help at every step of the way - from application, to financial aid, getting registered for dorms, to picking you classes. Click on the counselor's profile page to learn more about these amazing people!

Ready to get a taste of a life-changing Christian community dedicated to higher learning? The beautiful, ranch-style campus nestled in a Southern-California canyon can be experienced in a few ways. Come for a personal tour or with a group. Start your mustang experience by clicking the tabs to the right; we cannot wait to meet you!

What kind of financial aid is offered at TMU?

The important thing to know here is that a TMU education is a LOT more affordable than you think. We offer federal, state and institutional aid in the form of grants, loans, need based and merit based scholarships, and work study programs. Most of our students (93% at last count) receive some form of financial aid – why not you? The average TMU student receives over $20,000 in financial aid each year. Just make sure to get your application in early and to submit your FAFSA!
